page.title: 02FAIRFORD, A COTSWOLD TOWN
page.content: {Fairford}is a small town with many traditional Cotswold stone buildings. The oldest building is the imposing wool church of St.Mary's built in the late l5th century and renowned for its medieval stained glass. Fairford functions as a service centre for the surrounding villages and has a good range of retail outlets for the everyday shopper. Antique shops and a number of hotels and restaurants are a response to a steady stream of visitors. Fairford has a bank, a solicitor, a doctors' surgery, a dentist, a building society office, as well as two garages. Three schools - one private - provide education for local children. Public services include a cottage hospital, a police station, a fire station and a library (on three days a week).
